page.title: 18The Moon Squadrons.
page.content: One cannot talk of Tempsford with out a passing mention of it famous airfield and the flying squadrons which played such a vital role in WW II.From this airfield agents and supplies were dropped into ocuppied Europe.138 squadron arrived at Tempsford with two Lysanders,they were joined in 1942 by the 161 squadron who worked very closely with the French resistance. The squadrons were given the nickname of moon because they often flew on nights with a full moon often called a bombers moon. The people of Tempsford were aware of the nature of the operations at the airfield and told to keep this information secret for fear of German air raids on the airfield.Tempsford airfield in no longer in operation but there are plenty of military airfields nearby.
